title: Calls bet on Weatherford bounce
text:
Calls bet on Weatherford bounce By Mike Yamamoto (mike.yamamoto@optionmonster.com) September 24, 2015 11:46 AM ÓÅ± Done 
Traders are looking for Weatherford to rebound by the end of the year.optionMONSTER's Heat Seeker detected the purchase of 2,500 December 11 calls for $0.41 to $0.43 this morning. This represents new positions, as volume was well above the strike's open interest of 1,514 contracts.These long calls lock in the price where the stock can be purchased through mid-December no matter how far it might climb. They could be sold earlier at a profit if premiums rise with a rally before then, providing potentially significant leverage, but the contracts will expire worthless if shares remain below $11. (See our Education section)WFT is off 1.36 percent to $8.75 today and down 33 percent in the last three months. The oilfield-services firm gapped down from above $10 on Monday after proposing to sell $1 billion in stock and bonds for potential acquisitions, but it reversed that decision the very next day.Overall option volume in the name today is below its full-session average for the last month, but total calls are eclipsing puts by nearly 3 to 1 so far. More From optionMONSTER
